translation.en: [male narrator] One hundred human beings of all ages and backgrounds
representing a cross-section of American society
have been invited to participate in a unique experiment.
They will place themselves at the mercy of...
us.
Three curious hosts on a mission to answer questions
translation.ko: 호기심 많은 진행자 세 명이 인간 행동에 관한 의문에 답을 찾습니다

translation.en: we all have about human behavior.
translation.ko: 인간 행동에 관한 의문에 답을 찾습니다

translation.en: We're conducting an experiment that will require a little torture.
translation.ko: 실험을 하나 할 건데 고문을 좀 해야 해요

translation.en: [Alie] They will be taking part in a series of scientific studies
that we design in order to discover what makes people tick.
translation.ko: 무엇이 사람을 움직이게 하는지 실험을 통해 밝혀내려고 합니다

translation.en: -Kick it up a notch. -[hoots]
[Zainab] We will answer everything you've ever wanted to know about humanity.
translation.ko: 인류에 관한 궁금증을 전부 풀어드릴 겁니다

translation.en: -[gasps] -Give us a sample of sperm.
We're all biased.
So people are bad.
[laughing] No!
-I definitely do front to back. -Why do you have a preference?
translation.ko: 꼭 앞에서 뒤로 닦아요 왜 그게 더 좋으세요?

translation.en: To keep the trash out of the... playhouse.
[Zainab] Nobel Prize, here we come.
This is 100 Humans.
Welcome, 100 humans!
Look around, look at each other right now.
Can you gauge who among you
is the best-looking?
Fifty percent of you are in the best-looking half of the group
translation.ko: 여러분 중 50%는 이 집단에서 잘생긴 편이고

translation.en: and 50% of you are not.
Take your red cards, place them on top of your head
if you believe that you are not
translation.ko: 내가 잘생긴 편인 50%에 포함되지 않는다고 생각하면

translation.en: in the top 50% best-looking among you.
translation.ko: 빨간색 카드를 머리 위로 들어 주세요

translation.en: [Sammy] For those of you holding the card above your head,
please exit the square.
[Alie] By definition, only 50 of our 100 humans
can be in the top half of good-looking people,
yet 74 of them remain.
That's a lot more than 50.
[Sammy] Of those of you remaining,
take a good look at everyone around you.
I mean, even closer this time.
If you believe that you are not in the best-looking 50%
translation.ko: 지금 남은 사람 중 잘생긴 편인 50%에

translation.en: of the humans remaining, hold the card over your head.
translation.ko: 당신이 들지 않으면 머리 위로 카드를 드세요

translation.en: You may exit the square.
[Zainab] If the humans aren't lying to themselves,
half of the 74 should exit, leaving 37 humans.
Statistically, these numbers don't add up.
translation.ko: 통계적으로 이 숫자는 말이 안 돼요

translation.en: It's a good thing this wasn't a math experiment, right?
In this episode of 100 Humans,
we'll explore the deep dark cavernous corners of the power of attraction.
translation.ko: 깊고 어두운 구석구석까지 매력의 힘을 연구해 볼 겁니다

translation.en: We'll be asking all the hard questions,
like does being a good dancer mean you've got some really potent swimmers?
translation.ko: 춤을 잘 춘다는 건 정력이 아주 세다는 뜻일까요?

translation.en: Can being funny get you laid?
translation.ko: 유머 감각으로 뜨거운 밤을 보낼 수 있을까요?

translation.en: I see you, every male comedian ever.
And finally, can good looks keep you out of jail?
translation.ko: 마지막으로 잘생기면 감옥에 안 가게 될까요?

translation.en: So get ready to dive deep into human beings' sexual psyches
translation.ko: 인간의 성적 심리에 아주 깊숙이 들어가서

translation.en: to see what makes them tick.
Let's say you go to a club and you see a guy who's not Hollywood hot,
translation.ko: 클럽에 갔더니 그냥저냥 괜찮은 남자가 있어요

translation.en: but he's got dance moves, so that makes him, like, really hot.
translation.ko: 그런데 춤을 잘 추면 진짜 섹시해 보이죠

translation.en: I want to know, is there a biological connection?
Like, does a man's outward
swagger and smooth moves
send a message of reproductive potency?
Meaning, the guy that dances the best has the higher sperm count?
translation.ko: 춤을 잘 추는 남자가 정자가 더 많냐고요?

translation.en: Boom.
Um, I mean, that's a loaded question.
[Alie] It's time to put Sammy's theory to the test.
In our first experiment, we ask the question
translation.ko: 첫 번째 실험에서는 이걸 알아볼 겁니다

translation.en: "Are good dance moves a sign of a high sperm count?"
translation.ko: 춤을 잘 춘다는 건 정자가 많다는 걸까요?

translation.en: [Sammy] Okay, humans.
We're looking for some volunteers.
All right, please raise your hand if you like to dance.
Keep your hands raised if you like to dance
and are willing to compete in a dancing contest.
translation.ko: 나갈 생각이 있으시면 손을 계속 들고 계세요

translation.en: Bring it, baby.
I could "Cabbage Patch" all day.
translation.ko: 양배추 인형 춤을 종일 출 수 있어요

translation.en: [Alie] Keep your hands up if you like to dance,
translation.ko: 춤추기를 좋아하고 춤 경연 대회에 나갈 의향이 있고

translation.en: you are willing to compete in a dancing competition,
translation.ko: 춤추기를 좋아하고 춤 경연 대회에 나갈 의향이 있고 남자분이시라면 손을 들고 계세요

translation.en: and also you are a man.
-[Alie] Okay. -[woman sighs heavily]
-[Alie] So sorry. -[man] Yeah!
[Zainab] Keep your hands up if you like to dance,
translation.ko: 손을 들고 계세요 춤추는 걸 좋아하고 춤 경연 대회에 나갈 생각이 있고

translation.en: if you're willing to compete in a dance contest,
translation.ko: 춤추는 걸 좋아하고 춤 경연 대회에 나갈 생각이 있고

translation.en: if you're a male
and if you are willing to give us a sample of sperm...
for science.
[Alie] Lab assistants, please record the numbers of the volunteers.
translation.ko: 실험 보조 여러분 지원자 번호를 적어 두세요

translation.en: [Sammy] To determine whether or not a man's dance skills have any correlation with his level of virility,
translation.ko: 남자의 춤 실력이 정력과 연관성이 있는지 알아보기 위해서

translation.en: we'll be extracting their sperm into what science refers to as "a cup."
translation.ko: 과학이 '컵'이라고 부르는 것에 참가자들의 정액을 받을 겁니다

translation.en: To conduct our sperm-count test,
we ensured the anonymity of our humans by throwing these bags over their heads.
translation.ko: 머리에 종이봉투를 씌워서 참가자들의 익명성을 보장했습니다

translation.en: We'll task our unpaid interns with extracting their semen
translation.ko: 무급 인턴에게 정액을 받아 오게 할 거고요

translation.en: by any means necessary.
Sperm-collection protocol insists that these ten samples
translation.ko: 정액 수집 프로토콜에 의하면 정액 샘플 10개가 식기 전에

translation.en: get to the sperm lab before they cool off.
Once the lab receives the sperm,
we will commence the sperm-off.
I mean, "dance-off."
But first, we wanted to check in with neuroscientist, Daniel Levitin
translation.ko: 하지만 우선, 신경 과학자인 대니얼 레비틴 박사가 우리 의견을

translation.en: to find out what he thought of our theory.
Darwin actually predicted,
people who could dance were showing reproductive fitness.
translation.ko: 춤을 출 수 있는 사람은 생식 능력을 보여 주는 거라고요

translation.en: The kinds of dance that was done for tens of thousands of years
by our ancestors.
And if you could dance well and for a long time
translation.ko: 춤을 오랫동안 잘 춘다는 건 체력이랑 신체 능력을

translation.en: it showed stamina, physical fitness.
translation.ko: 체력이랑 신체 능력을 보여 주는 거예요

translation.en: It indicated to a potential mate that you had enough food resources to be healthy
translation.ko: 그건 잠재적 짝이 건강할 정도로 식량을 충분히 가지고 있다는 거고

translation.en: and it indicated that you didn't have any neurological disorders.
So what all that meant was, "He's got good genes."
translation.ko: 그러니까 전반적으로 뛰어난 유전자를 가진 거죠

translation.en: It's signaling, in what they call the honest signal hypothesis,
translation.ko: '정직한 신호 가설'에 의하면 신호를 보내는 거고요

translation.en: reproductive fitness.
You know, the peacock's tail is an interesting illustration of this.
translation.ko: 수컷 공작 꼬리는 이에 대한 흥미로운 예시예요

translation.en: -Would you indulge me? -Sure.
It's one of my favorite stories.
It sounds like you're very excited about it, so...
Think about the peacock's tail, this colorful, showy display.
translation.ko: 수컷 공작 꼬리는 다채롭고 화려한 모양이죠

translation.en: It's actually a predator magnet.
You know, he's strutting around calling attention to himself
and peacocks have a number of predators.
So what the peacock is signaling to the peahen
translation.ko: 그러니까 수컷 공작이 암컷 공작에게 보내는 신호는

translation.en: is, "I've got a nitrogen-rich diet that creates these wonderful colors
translation.ko: 이렇게 화려한 색을 낼 정도로 나는 질소가 풍부한 먹이를 먹고

translation.en: and I'm so fast and tough that I can just sort of taunt all the bad predators
translation.ko: 포식자를 조롱하고 달아날 만큼 아주 빠르고 강인한 수컷이니까

translation.en: and get away with it, so you should choose me."
It's called an honest signal. You can't fake that tail,
translation.ko: 그걸 정직한 신호라고 해요 꼬리를 가짜로 꾸밀 순 없죠

translation.en: and living through attacks, being able to run away from them.
translation.ko: 포식자의 공격에서 달아나 가짜로 생존할 수도 없고요

translation.en: [Zainab] And now we go to one of our human peacocks
translation.ko: 이제 우리 인간 공작이 매력의 힘에 관해서

translation.en: to find out what burning questions they have about the power of attraction.
translation.ko: 이제 우리 인간 공작이 매력의 힘에 관해서 뭘 가장 궁금해하는지 알아보죠

translation.en: I'm a chef and when I wear my uniform,
I get more dates.
My question is, "Are women more attracted to men in uniforms?"
translation.ko: 그럼 여자는... 제복 입은 남자한테 더 끌리나요?

translation.en: [Zainab] In our next experiment,
we're asking, "Does a uniform really make you more attractive?"
translation.ko: 제복을 입으면 더 매력적으로 보이는지 알아보죠

translation.en: To find out, we went and found some people in uniforms.
translation.ko: 답을 알아내기 위해 제복을 입은 사람을 찾았습니다

translation.en: Police officers,
janitors,
surgeons,
fast-food workers,
army officers
and pilots.
But here's the secret.
They're all actors in costume.
Our humans don't know that.
All they know is that they're going to meet some very single
and very available men and women.
translation.ko: 여유 있는 남자와 여자를 만날 거라고만 알고 있죠

translation.en: To test the uniform effect,
we're putting our humans in a social situation
translation.ko: 어떤 사회적 상황에 참가자들을 몰아넣을 겁니다

translation.en: that requires a first impression to be assessed in under three minutes.
Hello, humans.
[all] Hi.
Today we're going to be doing a live experiment to test first impressions.
translation.ko: 오늘은 즉석에서 첫인상 실험을 할 겁니다

translation.en: [Alie] Each stranger will tell you a little bit about themselves,
translation.ko: 이분들이 자신에 관해 얘기해 줄 텐데

translation.en: but you are not permitted to ask them any questions.
translation.ko: 여러분은 질문을 절대 하실 수 없어요

translation.en: Just fill out your survey,
I'll blow my whistle,
you'll rotate to the next station.
[Zainab] In order to test whether uniforms make people more attractive,
translation.ko: 제복을 입으면 더 매력적인지 실험하기 위해

translation.en: half of our humans will meet people in uniforms
translation.ko: 참가자 절반은 제복을 입은 사람을 만나고

translation.en: and the other half will meet the same actors in street clothes.
translation.ko: 나머지 반은 일상복을 입은 똑같은 배우를 만날 겁니다

translation.en: The humans will rate these strangers on looks,
personality and physical appeal on a scale of one through ten.
translation.ko: 성격과 신체적 매력을 10점 만점으로 평가할 거고요

translation.en: Hi, I'm Lauren.
I've been with the LAPD for five years and, uh,
in my spare time, I like to play guitar
and barbecue.
My friends say I'm a master at the grill.
translation.ko: 친구들이 그러는데 제가 고기를 잘 굽는대요

translation.en: My favorite thing about Los Angeles is Santa Monica.
People think I'm tough, but I, um,
I really love animals.
A lot of women like a man in uniform
translation.ko: 많은 여자가 제복 입은 남자를 좋아해요

translation.en: so a police officer...
-[Alie] Does it depend on the uniform? -It depends on the uniform
translation.ko: 제복에 따라 다른가요? 제복에 따라 다르죠 어떤 여자나 친구가

translation.en: because I don't think I've ever heard
translation.ko: 제복에 따라 다르죠 어떤 여자나 친구가

translation.en: a woman or a friend be, like, "Oh, that janitor over there.... Mm, that uniform."
translation.ko: 이런 적은 없거든요 '저 관리인, 제복 좀 봐'

translation.en: -[second man] Hi. -Hi.
I'm Dave. I am a sanitation engineer.
On the weekends, I like to go to the park, feed some ducks.
translation.ko: 주말에는 공원에 가서 오리한테 먹이를 주곤 해요

translation.en: Quack, quack.
When I found out I was speed dating, I instantly looked at all the guys,
translation.ko: 스피드 데이트라고 해서 바로 모든 남자를 확인했어요

translation.en: obviously, but I did find a charm in person B.
translation.ko: 당연한 거죠, 그런데 B 스테이션 남자가 매력적이었어요

translation.en: I don't know, just any sort of jumpsuit is overall, like...
translation.ko: 왜인지 몰라도 그냥 점프 슈트는 뭐랄까...

translation.en: -Cool. -[Alie] Okay.
[Zainab] I wonder if the more elite professionals, like surgeons, army officers and pilots
translation.ko: 의사나 군인, 조종사 등 사회적 지위가 더 높은 직업군이

translation.en: will be rated as more attractive.
We'll see what the surveys say.
-Hi, how are you? -I'm good.
My name is Jerry.
I went to school in Chicago.
I like to go skiing in Big Bear, sometimes Aspen.
translation.ko: 빅베어에서 스키 타는 걸 좋아해요 가끔은 애스펀에서 타고요

translation.en: My name is Nicky.
I've been an airline pilot for ten years
and I listen to oldies and Motown.
I would date the airline pilot.
She seemed to have the right balance of personality and looks.
translation.ko: 성격이랑 외모가 딱 적당한 것 같았어요

translation.en: Hi, I'm Jackie.
Um, I've been in the Army for like over ten years now.
I like the woman in the military uniform.
My name is Jackie.
Well, in my downtime I like to just hang out
at the beach.
[Human #96] Someone who, like, has authority over me
is a little attractive
and they stand with like, um... a confidence.
translation.ko: 그런 사람은... 자신 있게 서 있어요

translation.en: It's sexy.
What's up? I'm Mike.
I work for a major fast-food chain.
I get a lot of pleasure out of my job because I enjoy seeing the smiles
translation.ko: 저는 제 일이 즐거워요 사람들이 음식을 받을 때 웃는 걸 보는 게 좋거든요

translation.en: on people's faces when they get their food
translation.ko: 사람들이 음식을 받을 때 웃는 걸 보는 게 좋거든요

translation.en: and I like helping people.
As I worked my way down this dating line,
one particular gentleman stood out.
I don't actually remember his name 'cause I was mesmerized by his face
translation.ko: 얼굴에 푹 빠져서 사실 이름이 기억 안 나요

translation.en: and I wasn't really paying attention to what he was saying. [Zainab] What uniform was he in?
translation.ko: - 얘기에 집중하지 못했죠 - 무슨 제복을 입었어요?

translation.en: -Um, fast food. [laughing] -Okay.
He was a burger boy, but he was cute.
-Okay. -He could get it.
[Zainab] All right, clearly our humans are getting a little randy down there.
translation.ko: 좋습니다, 확실히 참가자들이 좀 흥분한 것 같네요

translation.en: But what if those same actors change into their regular clothes?
translation.ko: 그런데 똑같은 배우가 일상복을 입으면 어떨까요?

translation.en: To make sure the test isn't skewed,
our actors are going to have the same job
and use the same exact script
while meeting an entirely different set of humans.
The only difference is the actors are in plain clothes
and not in a uniform.
I'm Lindsey. I work for a major fast-food chain.
I enjoy helping people.
Currently I'm living here in Los Angeles working as a neurosurgeon.
I like to go skiing in Big Bear, sometimes Aspen.
translation.ko: 빅베어에서 스키 타는 걸 좋아해요 가끔은 애스펀에서 타고요

translation.en: The neurosurgeon, he was very handsome
but he was very self-entitled.
translation.ko: 신경외과 의사는 정말 잘생겼는데... 자신감이 과해요

translation.en: Very like, "Oh, I like to go to Aspen."
I'm like, "I like it, too," but I don't like the way he was talking.
translation.ko: 저도 좋아하지만 말투가 마음에 안 들어요

translation.en: I am a sanitation engineer.
On the weekends, I like to go to the park,
feed some ducks. Quack quack.
Quack, quack. Quack, quack. Quack, quack.
I would say overall, personality-wise,
I didn't find any too attractive.
[Zainab] Are you kidding? A janitor and ducks!
Break me off a piece of this guy.
[man] I've been working for the LAPD for 15 years.
People think I'm tough but I really have a soft spot for animals.
translation.ko: 다들 저를 거칠게 보는데 사실 동물한테는 정말 약해요

translation.en: I like people that like animals.
You know, I was, like, connecting with him
translation.ko: 그 남자랑은 잘 통한 것 같고 그래요

translation.en: and then, you know, that was a fleeting moment.
translation.ko: 그 남자랑은 잘 통한 것 같고 그래요 그냥 아주 잠깐요

translation.en: -Nice meeting you. -[Human #95] Nice meeting you.
[Zainab] And here are the results.
Women found a man in uniform to be less attractive
translation.ko: 여자는 제복을 입은 남자보다 일상복을 입은 남자에게 더 끌렸습니다

translation.en: than a man in street clothes.
So I guess the fact that my dad left my mom for the milkman
translation.ko: 우유 배달원 때문에 아버지가 어머니를 떠난 건

translation.en: had nothing to do with his outfit.
Men, however, found women equally attractive
whether they were in uniform or not.
Thus proving our theory that men are attracted to anything as long as it moves.
translation.ko: 남자는 누구든 움직이기만 하면 끌린다는 이론을 증명하는군요

translation.en: So overall, there was no jump in attraction
except for certain professions.
When it came to police officers,
women thought they were way better-looking in uniform
translation.ko: 제복을 입었을 때 안 입었을 때보다

translation.en: then out of uniform.
Pilots, not so much.
Not a big difference there.
Clearly our humans don't give a crap about how hard it is to become a pilot.
translation.ko: 조종사가 되기 얼마나 힘든지 신경도 안 쓰는 게 분명하군요

translation.en: When it came to janitors and fast-food workers,
our humans found them to be less attractive in uniform than out of uniform,
translation.ko: 제복을 입었을 때보다 안 입었을 때 더 끌렸습니다

translation.en: indicating that good financial prospects are a crucial part of attraction.
translation.ko: 즉, 뛰어난 경제 능력이 매력에 중요한 부분이라는 거죠

translation.en: To which I say, "Duh!"
Okay, so being rich has its advantages when it comes to the power of attraction,
translation.ko: 좋아요, 그럼 매력 측면에서 돈이 많은 게 유리하긴 한데

translation.en: but do you think good-looking people get away with more?
translation.ko: 잘생긴 사람이 더 특별 대우를 받을까요?

translation.en: Like more than an average-looking person?
A lot of people believe that if you go on trial for something
and you're good-looking, the jury will give you a lighter sentence
translation.ko: 정말 많은 사람이 형을 가볍게 받거나 무죄를 선고받을 거라고 믿어요

translation.en: or even acquit you.
translation.ko: 형을 가볍게 받거나 무죄를 선고받을 거라고 믿어요

translation.en: [Sammy] In our next experiment, we ask
can good looks keep you out of jail?
To begin, we've divided up our humans into two groups of fifty.
Group A will see one set of mugshots
translation.ko: A 집단은 범죄자 사진을 여러 장 볼 거고

translation.en: and Group B will see an entirely different set
translation.ko: B 집단은 전혀 다른 사진을 볼 건데

translation.en: but the crimes will be exactly the same.
This is our humans' chance to play judge and jury,
but we want to know how sympathetic they'll be
if the criminal isn't too bad on the eyes.
Hello, humans.
[all] Hello.
What we're doing is conducting a survey on criminal justice.
translation.ko: 사법 제도에 관해 설문 조사를 할 거예요

translation.en: Crime, punishment.
What does it take to pay back society
translation.ko: 특정 범죄에 대해서 사회에 보상하려면 어떻게 해야 할까요?

translation.en: for certain offenses?
And so what we did is we went and conducted interviews, we took photos
translation.ko: 그래서 저희가 교정 시설에 가서 인터뷰를 하고

translation.en: at a few different correctional facilities
and we got their stories.
Now, these were all people who were found guilty of their crimes
translation.ko: 이 사람들은 전부 유죄 선고를 받았어요

translation.en: and your job today is to act as a judge
to determine what length of sentence is appropriate
translation.ko: 특정 범죄에 형량을 얼마나 선고하는 게

translation.en: in prison for the particular offense.
Okay?
[Sammy] What our humans don't know
is that the people seen in the mugshots aren't real criminals,
translation.ko: 사진 속 사람들이 진짜 범죄자가 아니라 배우라는 걸

translation.en: they're actors.
For our attractive criminals, we picked people who are classically beautiful.
translation.ko: 전형적으로 아름다운 사람들을 우리 매력적인 범죄자로 뽑았고

translation.en: For our less attractive group, we chose people who aren't.
translation.ko: 그렇지 않은 사람들을 덜 매력적인 범죄자로 뽑았죠

translation.en: Dan was dealing in illegal drugs
and he was arrested after a raid at his residence
where police discovered a meth lab and four pounds of methamphetamine
alongside $26,000 in cash.
This is Dan.
Dan was actually dealing in illegal drugs.
There was a raid at his residence.
Police found a meth lab and over four pounds of methamphetamine.
He also was in possession of $26,000 in cash.
He also had in the home
four handguns and one automatic rifle.
translation.ko: 권총 4자루랑 자동 소총 한 자루가 있었어요

translation.en: [Sammy] Remember, both groups are hearing details of the exact same crime.
translation.ko: 두 집단은 완전히 똑같은 범죄에 관해 들었지만

translation.en: But each group is seeing an entirely different mugshot.
You keeping up over there?
So the recommended sentence for Dan is between three years to ten years.
So give it a second and think about
what length of sentence you would give him.
Just looking at the picture itself, he looks like he's on that s*** too.
translation.ko: 사진만 보면 자기도 마약을 한 것 같네요

translation.en: And to have somebody that unstable
with a possible exploding meth lab and all these different firearms,
translation.ko: 마약 공장을 폭파할 수도 있고 화기도 여러 종류를 갖고 있어요

translation.en: he could be capable of anything so personally I gave him life.
translation.ko: 무슨 짓을 할지 모르니까 저는 종신형을 줄 겁니다

translation.en: [Sammy] So what was the average sentence for the less attractive Dan?
translation.ko: 덜 매력적인 댄은 평균 몇 년 형을 받았을까요?

translation.en: The reason why he probably had, um, guns is probably to protect himself.
translation.ko: 아마 자신을 보호하려고 총을 갖고 있었을 거예요

translation.en: It's a dangerous business to be in.
So I would give him probably seven years,
translation.ko: 그래서 저는 아마 7년 형을 줄 것 같아요

translation.en: to let him think on it and get an, uh, education
translation.ko: 자기 죄를 뉘우치고 교육도 받게 하려고요

translation.en: or something behind him.
[Sammy] And now, the average sentence for the more attractive Dan.
translation.ko: 그럼 더 매력적인 댄은 평균 몇 년 형을 받았을까요?

translation.en: Whoa, looks like attractive Dan got a lot more sympathy.
translation.ko: "더 매력적인 범죄자: 8년" 매력적인 댄이 훨씬 더 동정을 받는 것 같네요

translation.en: Yeah, five years worth.
Let's see the next one.
[Alie] JT was found guilty of robbing over 30 homes.
translation.ko: 제이티는 집 30채를 털어서 유죄 선고를 받았어요

translation.en: His MO was waiting until a delivery truck dropped off packages
translation.ko: 제이티는 배달 트럭에서 소포를 내릴 때까지 기다렸다가

translation.en: and stealing them from the porch.
He later sold or pawned most of the items.
Now he doesn't look unattractive to me, it's just the face that he's making.
translation.ko: 매력이 없진 않아요 그냥 표정을 그렇게 지었네요

translation.en: He doesn't look unattractive at all.
He looks like almost every football player I've ever seen in the NFL, actually.
I mean, packages on the front of doorsteps
is not, uh, you know, hurting anybody physically or anything like that.
So yeah, three years on him.
I was a victim of a home invasion robbery.
translation.ko: 저는 주거 침입 강도 사건 피해자였어요

translation.en: And the things that I worked for as an adult, gone. Never get back.
translation.ko: 열심히 벌어서 다 잃었죠 하나도 돌려받지 못했어요

translation.en: That is not a victimless crime and I will stand up and tell you so.
translation.ko: 제가 확실히 말하는데 그건 피해자 없는 범죄가 아니에요

translation.en: So far, the attractive criminals are getting a way better deal.
translation.ko: "더 매력적인 범죄자: 3년" 매력적인 범죄자들이 훨씬 후한 판결을 받네요

translation.en: Yeah, but this next case involves a loss of life.
translation.ko: 네, 하지만 다음 사건엔 인명 피해가 있어요

translation.en: So let's see how much of a difference it'll make there.
[Alie] So this is Sarah.
Sarah was convicted of manslaughter
for leaving her one-year-old child
in a car while she drank in the afternoon in a bar.
translation.ko: 낮에 술집에서 술을 마시는 동안 자신의 1살짜리 아이를 차에 그냥 내버려 뒀죠

translation.en: The outside temperature that day happened to be 98 degrees,
so unfortunately the child did pass away.
The recommended sentence for her
was between seven years to fifteen years.
[Sammy] Okay, manslaughter is a serious crime.
Is this guilty criminal's attractiveness
going to get her more sympathy than her counterpart?
Let's hear the judgment on the less good-looking criminal first.
translation.ko: 덜 매력적인 범죄자에 대한 판결부터 들어 보도록 하죠

translation.en: I gave her, uh, 30 years.
Someone like that needs to be put away for a long time.
-I gave her 20 years. -[Alie] Okay.
I think that you should know better.
It's not an accident.
I gave her seven years because I think she's going to beat up herself
translation.ko: 어차피 평생 자신을 자책할 거라고 생각해서

translation.en: for the rest of her life.
She's got to live with that pain for the rest of her life.
That, in itself, is, you know... is worse than even the time that she serves.
translation.ko: 징역을 사는 시간보다 그게 더 끔찍할 거예요

translation.en: [Sammy] And the average sentence for the baby killer...
To find out why our humans gave good-looking criminals
translation.ko: 잘생긴 범죄자들에게 왜 이렇게 관대한 형량을 줬는지

translation.en: such lenient sentences,
I sat down with Professor of Law, Jody Armour.
-Can being pretty keep you out of jail? -No doubt.
Your unconscious bias
can make you morally judge somebody more harshly
translation.ko: 어떤 사람을 도덕적으로 더 심하게 재단할 수 있어요

translation.en: because they come from a stereotyped group.
translation.ko: 어떤 집단에 대한... 고정 관념 때문에요

translation.en: The darker-skinned you are, the more deathworthy you're deemed.
translation.ko: 피부색이 어두울수록 더 죽을죄를 지었다고 생각하죠

translation.en: So I have skin that gets really light or dark easily
translation.ko: 저는 피부색이 - 계절에 따라 쉽게 변해요 - 네

translation.en: -with the seasons. -Yes.
Now here's a tough question.
Should I commit crimes in January to get a lesser sentence,
but then don't forget about summer bod.
Hey, but here's the answer to that question.
You have to make sure that by the time you go to trial
you've stayed out of the sun
because then the lighter you will be there for the jury to look at.
translation.ko: 배심원이 당신을 볼 때 피부가 더 밝아야 하니까요

translation.en: And that's who they're making their judgment on, the basis of the defendant they're seeing in front of them.
translation.ko: 눈앞에 있는 피고에 대해 그걸 바탕으로 판단할 거예요

translation.en: So speaking of lighter-skinness,
are you saying that kind of Western traditional attractiveness,
that's going to play better in these situations
where you're receiving a lesser sentence?
What you find is
we are going to make a moral judgment of them that's much harsher for the unattractive than the attractive one.
translation.ko: 우리는 매력적이지 않은 사람을 도덕적으로 더 엄격하게 재단해요

translation.en: That's moral luck.
That's like flipping a coin and saying if you're attractive,
translation.ko: 동전을 던져서 당신이 매력적이면 덜 나쁘고

translation.en: you're less wicked. If you're unattractive, you're really wicked.
translation.ko: 매력적이지 않다면 진짜 나쁘다고 하는 셈이에요

translation.en: Okay, scale of one to ten, how attractive am I?
You have all the things that will have a jury sit there
translation.ko: 배심원이 보고 형량을 적게 주자고 할 만한 것을

translation.en: and say, "I'm going to give him less of a sentence
translation.ko: 배심원이 보고 형량을 적게 주자고 할 만한 것을 당신은 다 가지고 있어요

translation.en: than I'm going to give somebody who doesn't have the same symmetry
translation.ko: 당신보다 골격이나 이목구비가 못한 사람한테는 형량을 더 줄 거고요

translation.en: and doesn't have the same features."
translation.ko: 못한 사람한테는 형량을 더 줄 거고요

translation.en: That's just the truth.
Just as I have to recognize my male privilege,
translation.ko: 제가 남성의 특권을 인정해야 하는 것처럼...

translation.en: you have to recognize your attractiveness privilege.
I knew I had some kind of struggle.
That's what it is. It's attractive privilege.
-It is. -People treat you differently
and I'm like, "Treat me like a normal person, okay?
You don't have to be nice to me 'cause I'm hot."
translation.ko: 네? 제가 섹시하다고 잘해 줄 필요는 없다고요

translation.en: Yeah, you have an infectious smile.
[Alie] Is an infectious smile just one of the many attractive qualities you possess?
translation.ko: 기분 좋은 미소 말고도 매력적인 요소를 많이 가지셨나요?

translation.en: Well, f*** you. And congratulations.
The world sees you different, gorgeous.
And you too, handsome.
But why? What is it about your godlike physical attractiveness
translation.ko: 그런데 왜죠? 신의 경지에 이른 신체적 매력이

translation.en: that confers all these benefits on to you?
It's called "the halo effect."
And it's not your fault, you screaming hot hottie.
translation.ko: 끝내주게 섹시한 게 당신 잘못은 아니에요

translation.en: It's ours.
When we, the comparatively ugly,
see that perfectly symmetrical jawline of yours,
translation.ko: 완벽한 대칭을 이루는 턱선과 체육관에서 만든 복근과

translation.en: those gym-toned abs, those impossibly uncalloused feet
translation.ko: 완벽한 대칭을 이루는 턱선과 체육관에서 만든 복근과 말도 안 되게 부드럽고 곱디고운 발을 보면

translation.en: without a hammertoe in the bunch,
translation.ko: 말도 안 되게 부드럽고 곱디고운 발을 보면

translation.en: we cannot help but automatically assume that every other thing about you is great as well.
translation.ko: 다른 것도 다 근사할 거라고 생각하지 않고는 못 배기거든요

translation.en: Your attractiveness means you are nice.
It means you are smart.
It means you are trustworthy,
and it even means you are good, even if you're not.
translation.ko: 착할 것 같아요 사실 그렇지 않더라고요

translation.en: What a racket. Such is the power of beauty.
translation.ko: 정말 말도 안 되죠 아름다움은 참 강력해요

translation.en: It creates in the beholder a powerful cognitive bias,
translation.ko: 아름다움은 보는 이에게 강력한 인지 편향을 일으키고

translation.en: clouding our judgment with all sorts of misinformation
translation.ko: 온갖 잘못된 정보로 판단을 흐리게 합니다

translation.en: based solely on the fact that you're doing things to our loins.
translation.ko: 그저 우리 마음을 뭔가 건드린다는 이유로요

translation.en: Of course, you insufferable cuties are just as likely as anyone else
translation.ko: 물론 깨물고 싶을 정도로 귀여워도 누구 못지않게 친절하고 똑똑하지만

translation.en: to be nice and smart, but let's get real.
translation.ko: 누구 못지않게 친절하고 똑똑하지만 생각해 보면 아름다운 얼굴도 별거 아닙니다

translation.en: A good-looking face doesn't mean s***.
translation.ko: 생각해 보면 아름다운 얼굴도 별거 아닙니다

translation.en: It just means you've got really, really, really great cheekbones.
translation.ko: 그냥 광대뼈가 정말 엄청나게 근사할 뿐이죠

translation.en: Now, has anyone seen Sammy's contouring brush?
Now, there's a reason our humans all dress like they just got out of rehab.
translation.ko: 참가자들이 재활 시설에서 나온 것처럼 입은 이유가 있습니다

translation.en: This uniform strips away any preconceived notions
translation.ko: 이 단체복은 당연히 옷에 따른 선입관을

translation.en: based on clothes, of course.
If you put 100 humans together, you're gonna get some flirting.
translation.ko: 100명을 같이 두면 서로 호감이 생기기 마련이죠

translation.en: From our observations, it's always the funniest ones that get the most attention.
translation.ko: 저희가 관찰해 보니 재미있는 사람이 관심을 받던데

translation.en: Could it be that being funny makes people more attractive?
translation.ko: 유머 감각이 있으면 더 매력적으로 보일까요?

translation.en: Welcome to experiment number four,
where we ask does being funny make you sexier?
translation.ko: 유머 감각이 있으면 더 섹시하게 느껴질까요?

translation.en: To begin our experiment, we've divided our humans into two audiences
translation.ko: 우선 참가자들을 두 관객 집단으로 나누고

translation.en: and enlisted the help of two struggling stand-up comics.
translation.ko: 스탠드업 코미디언 두 사람에게 협력을 구했습니다

translation.en: They're equally talented and relatively average in the looks department.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 재능이 있고 외모도 비교적 평균입니다

translation.en: Humans, are you ready for your next experiment?
-[all] Yes. -[man] Yeah.
This experiment is going to test verbal presentation skills.
translation.ko: 이번 실험에서는... 구두 발표 능력을 시험할 겁니다

translation.en: You'll hear from two speakers and then you'll rate their performances.
translation.ko: 두 발표자가 나올 텐데 얼마나 잘했는지 평가해 주세요

translation.en: [Alie] To create a baseline,
Andy and Dina are going to tell each group a very boring story.
translation.ko: 앤디와 디나는 각 집단에 아주 지루한 얘기를 할 겁니다

translation.en: Hello, my name's Andy.
Um, I'm going to tell you a story about
how I came to live in Los Angeles.
I lived in, um, a hostel.
There was a lot of things that made me decide that I wanted to cancel my gym membership.
translation.ko: 여러 가지 이유 때문에 체육관 회원권을 취소하고 싶었죠

translation.en: Like, the equipment was always dirty.
[Alie] Fascinating stuff.
I think our humans have pretty much checked out.
translation.ko: 참가자들은 딱히 관심이 없는 것 같군요

translation.en: A tenant of the hostel was wearing one of my T-shirts.
translation.ko: 호스텔 세입자 한 명이 제 티셔츠를 입고 있었어요

translation.en: He took it out of the wash cycle, I believe.
translation.ko: 아마 세탁 중에 꺼낸 것 같아요

translation.en: So I went to the receptionist desk and I told the receptionist
translation.ko: 그래서 접수대에 가서 직원한테 회원권을 취소하고 싶다고 했더니

translation.en: that I wanted to cancel my membership
and he told me that I needed to go home and print out a cancellation form
translation.ko: 직원이 집에 가서 해지 신청서를 출력해서

translation.en: and then bring it back.
So I would just advise against ever living in a hostel
for longer than a week or two weeks.
translation.ko: 1-2주 이상 머무는 건 추천하고 싶지 않아요

translation.en: Thank you.
[Alie] Now that we've bored our humans to tears,
they'll rate Andy and Dina's presentation skills,
translation.ko: 이제 참가자들은 앤디와 디나의 발표 능력과

translation.en: charisma and physical appearance.
The data we're most interested in
is the average score the speakers receive for attractiveness.
Tell me, how'd you guys feel about Dina?
I thought she was cute but boring as f***.
-[all laughing] -Okay.
So would you date Andy?
Hell no.
I thought Andy was adorable in his delivery.
translation.ko: 앤디는 발표할 때 귀여운 것 같아요

translation.en: Like, "adorable?" You mean, like, "attractive?"
No. Uh, yeah...
-[all laughing] -No and yeah.
[Alie] Yes, no, maybe so.
On a scale of one to ten, survey says... kinda.
translation.ko: 설문 조사 결과도 10점 만점에... 그 정도네요

translation.en: Now let's swap the audiences and see if being funny
will boost the comedians' relative bonability.
translation.ko: 두 코미디언의 성적 매력을 유머 감각이 올려 줄지 지켜보죠

translation.en: Before I committed to moving to Hollywood, I lived in a hostel for two months
translation.ko: 할리우드로 이사하기 전에... 두 달간 호스텔에서 살았어요

translation.en: and I went up and did some hostel chores. You know, I, uh...
translation.ko: 호스텔에 들어가서 이런저런 일을 좀 했죠

translation.en: removed the chalk outline of the last tenant,
de-flead, wrote my suicide note.
-You know, hostel business. -[all laughing]
I went through a breakup recently.
It was a toxic relationship.
I feel like it was time for us to part ways and separate ourselves,
translation.ko: 이제 서로 다른 길을... 가야 할 때라고 느꼈어요

translation.en: so I broke up with the gym.
And I went down to the hostel laundry room
to do the drying and a person's wearing one of my T-shirts.
translation.ko: 어떤 사람이 제 티셔츠를 입고 있더라고요

translation.en: -Took it out of the wash cycle. -[all laughing]
translation.ko: 세탁 중에 꺼낸 거죠 대략 27분만 기다렸다면 바싹 마른 옷을

translation.en: He could have had a perfectly dry stolen good
if he would have waited like, what, 27 minutes.
So I went to the receptionist desk
and I told him that I wanted to cancel my membership.
He said, "Okay.
I just need you to go on home, print out a cancellation form
translation.ko: 그럼 집에 가서 해지 신청서를 출력해서

translation.en: and bring it back."
I was like, "Listen, I'm a 24-year-old.
-I don't have a printer." -[all laughing]
And anyone in here who's like, "I have a printer." No, you don't.
translation.ko: 누군가 나는 인쇄기가 있다고 생각하겠지만, 아니에요

translation.en: It's out of ink, out of paper, out of toner.
It won't connect to the Internet, to the computer. It prints out things in wingdings.
translation.ko: 인터넷, 컴퓨터에 연결 안 됐고 외계어만 잔뜩 출력되잖아요

translation.en: [Alie] These humans are showing our comedians some love.
translation.ko: 이 참가자들은 두 코미디언을 꽤 좋아하네요

translation.en: What'd you think of Andy?
Yeah?
I didn't think he was that cute, but when someone's funny,
translation.ko: 처음엔 안 귀여웠는데 그래도 재미있는 사람은

translation.en: it makes them that much cuter. He like left and I was like,
translation.ko: 훨씬 귀여워 보여요 그래서 마지막엔 이런 느낌이었죠

translation.en: "Okay, Andy."
-[all laughing] -You know what I mean?
Did that happen for anybody else
in the room?
[Alie] So does being funny make you more attractive?
According to our 100 humans, boring Andy and boring Dina
translation.ko: 참가자 100명에 의하면 앤디와 디나는 농담을 잘할 때 매력 점수를 1점 정도 더 받았네요

translation.en: both went up a point when they made with the jokes.
translation.ko: 앤디와 디나는 농담을 잘할 때 매력 점수를 1점 정도 더 받았네요

translation.en: Quick, someone tell Sammy he can get laid.
translation.ko: 후끈한 밤을 보낼 수 있다고 누가 빨리 새미한테 말해 줘요!

translation.en: So we just saw that a humorous personality can make a person more attractive.
translation.ko: 유머 감각이 있으면 더 매력적일 수 있네요

translation.en: But what physical features make one person more attractive than the other?
translation.ko: 다른 사람보다 더 매력적으로 보이게 하는 신체 특징은 뭘까요?

translation.en: Is it symmetry, is it eye color, is it their hair, is it their skin tone?
translation.ko: 얼굴 대칭? 눈동자 색깔? 머리카락? 피부색?

translation.en: Well, we all know the gold standard of attractiveness
is tall, dark and handsome.
translation.ko: 키가 크고 피부가 까맣고 잘생긴 거요

translation.en: But, of course, sometimes you only get two out of three
translation.ko: 물론 세 가지 다 가질 수 없기도 하니까

translation.en: so dark and handsome.
You know, I think instead of relying on like old, worn-out clichés,
or you know, whatever your mom told you,
I like to rely on science and some scientists have determined
translation.ko: 과학을 믿고 싶네요 어떤 과학자들은 신체적 매력이

translation.en: that physical attraction is just based on this one really, really simple qualifier.
-Oh, dark? -No.
-Handsome. -Nope.
[Alie] Before I tell you, let's test it out on our home audience.
translation.ko: 그게 뭔지 얘기하기 전에 우리 시청자분들께 실험해 보죠

translation.en: Okay, dear viewer,
you get to help us find out what makes a person beautiful.
translation.ko: 무엇이 사람을 아름답게 하는지 알아내는 일을 좀 도와주세요

translation.en: Are you ready to be Human number 101?
I thought so. Here we go.
Humans come in all shapes and sizes,
but science says we're drawn to certain people for specific reasons.
translation.ko: 과학적으로 우리는 어떤 이유로 특정 사람들에게 끌린다고 합니다

translation.en: Take a close look at the following six faces.
translation.ko: 지금부터 나오는 여섯 명을 잘 보세요

translation.en: You'll be asked to select the most attractive.
translation.ko: 누가 가장 매력적인지 여러분께 물어볼 겁니다

translation.en: Watch again as we replay their faces a few times.
translation.ko: 몇 번 더 보여 드릴 테니 자세히 보세요

translation.en: Time to pick which face you think is most attractive.
translation.ko: 어떤 얼굴이 가장 매력적인지 이제 결정해 주세요

translation.en: So who do you choose?
According to research, most people will select face number four
for one simple reason: familiarity.
We humans are more attracted to faces our brains are familiar with
translation.ko: 인간은 뇌에 친숙한 얼굴에 더 끌립니다

translation.en: and we showed you this human's face for 11 seconds
translation.ko: 이 참가자의 얼굴을 11초 동안 보여 드렸고요

translation.en: compared to an average of five seconds for each of the other faces.
[Sammy] So familiarity breeds attraction?
[Alie] Try putting that on a Valentine's Day card.
-Sperm results are in. -What! How'd you get those?
translation.ko: 정자 결과 나왔어요 네? 어떻게 받았어요?

translation.en: They just dropped them off at the front desk.
I didn't get an alert.
Well, you know what that means?
Sperm-count dancing party.
[singing] ♪ Sperm-count dancing party ♪
-♪ I'm a sperm, I'm a sperm ♪ -♪ Sperm-count dancing party ♪
-♪ I'm swimming ♪ -[Alie] Whoo!
No, really, what are the results?
[Zainab] And now, let's circle back to experiment number one
translation.ko: 이제 첫 번째 실험으로 돌아가 보죠

translation.en: in which we're trying to determine if there's a correlation between great dance skills and a high sperm count.
translation.ko: 춤 솜씨와 정자 수 사이에 연관성이 있는지 알아볼 겁니다

translation.en: In our quest to determine if the male dancers
translation.ko: 우리 남성 댄서들이 아기를 만드는 주스를

translation.en: are also packing the most baby-making juice,
translation.ko: 우리 남성 댄서들이 아기를 만드는 주스를 잔뜩 가지고 있는지 확인해 보죠

translation.en: these ten fearless humans have volunteered to compete in a dance-off
translation.ko: 겁 없는 참가자 10명이 우리 목마른 참가자들 앞에서

translation.en: in front of our thirsty, thirsty humans.
Welcome, humans who prefer the company of men.
Yes, you do.
Today's your lucky day.
Are you ready for some male dancers?
[Sammy] Yeah.
All right, let's give a nice 100 Humans welcome
to our dancers!
[Zainab] Now that we have their sperm counts,
these ten humans are ready to be judged on their dance moves.
Will the men with the highest sperm count
also get the highest scores from the audience?
translation.ko: 관객에게 춤으로 가장 높은 점수를 받을까요?

translation.en: Will we prove once and for all that a man's skill on the dance floor
is the sign of how quickly he could knock up a woman?
translation.ko: 빠른 임신을 의미한다고 확실히 증명하게 될까요?

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, you are here to rate these dancers
translation.ko: 신사 숙녀 여러분 이 댄서들을 평가해 주세요

translation.en: on their attractiveness,
on their dancing ability,
on their sex appeal.
After each dancer, you'll get a chance
translation.ko: 지원자들이 한 명씩 춤을 추고 나면

translation.en: to fill out your survey and let us know how you feel.
translation.ko: 설문 조사를 할 테니 여러분 생각을 알려 주세요

translation.en: Shall we get the party started?
Dancer A, come on out!
[Zainab] This guy's got some great dance moves,
translation.ko: 이 참가자는 춤을 꽤 잘 추네요

translation.en: but how will that correlate to his sperm count?
[man] I used to be in a dance crew.
I'm really passionate about it.
All right, let's hear it for dancer A!
So now take a moment to fill out our surveys.
Let us know on a scale of one to ten
how much you want some A in your life.
[Zainab] The crowd is digging the moves on human A
translation.ko: 댄서 A의 춤을 관객도 신나게 즐겼지만

translation.en: but he's got a long line of competitors.
Let's welcome B to the stage!
Let's hear it for human B!
[Zainab] They say boxers should avoid spanking it before a match.
translation.ko: 권투 선수는 경기 전에 자위를 해선 안 된다고 하는데

translation.en: Does the same hold for dancing?
Make it loud for human C!
[Zainab] Some might call that dancing, but I call it air sex.
translation.ko: 누군가는 이걸 춤이라고 하지만 저는 그냥 섹스 흉내인 것 같네요

translation.en: C was definitely sexy.
I don't know, maybe he has some other part-time job.
[Zainab] Dancer C is giving his all, maybe he's carrying a full tank.
translation.ko: 댄서 C가 다 보여 주네요 통이 꽉 찼을지도 모르겠어요

translation.en: He learned that somewhere.
[Sammy] Let's hear it for human C!
[Zainab] Our audience is pretty fired up.
These dancers may have a lot of spunk in their funk,
translation.ko: 이 댄서들은 속이 꽉 찼나 봅니다

translation.en: by that I mean, they might have a lot of semen in their balls.
[Sammy] Human D!
Human E!
Human F!
[Zainab] Human F's breakdancing, or whatever you want to call that,
translation.ko: 댄서 F의 브레이크댄싱은... 이걸 뭐라고 부르든 간에

translation.en: is really working for our horny humans.
Sounds like his potency could be off the charts.
[Sammy] Human G!
Human H!
When I was younger, I did go to clubs
but I never saw anything like that in the clubs.
translation.ko: 하지만 클럽에서도 그런 건 못 봤어요

translation.en: [Sammy] Human I!
Big shout-outs to the other guys for doing their thing,
translation.ko: 다른 사람들이 춤출 때도 다 크게 환호하긴 했지만

translation.en: but, you know, can't nobody move like I can, baby.
Last but not least, human J!
[Human J] I gave them what I'm supposed to give them which is grand diva,
translation.ko: 관객이 원하는 걸 줬어요 엄청난 디바요

translation.en: and I think they got with it real rough.
Human J!
[Zainab] There's no denying those dance moves
left our audience satisfied and in need of a cigarette.
But how did our men measure up?
As night falls, 100 humans are invited
translation.ko: 해가 질 때쯤 참가자 100명을 뒤풀이에 초대했고

translation.en: to the after-party to hear the big results.
translation.ko: 참가자 100명을 뒤풀이에 초대했고 결과를 전하려고 합니다

translation.en: Hello, 100 humans.
Did you all enjoy that dancing?
[all cheering] Yeah!
[Alie] Okay, okay, okay.
What was really happening was we were testing a theory
that the sexiest dancer would also be the most virile,
meaning had the highest sperm count.
[mouthing] Oh my god.
[Zainab] Oh, yes.
So we went there.
[Sammy] These were your ten dancers.
Let's see how they did on their dance scores.
Wow,
on a scale of one to ten, we have some ranging
translation.ko: 10점 만점으로 평가했는데 4점도 안 되는 점수부터 9점까지 나왔네요

translation.en: from just less than four all the way to nine.
We had some hot dancers, right?
[all cheering] Yeah!
All right, now for the sperm counts.
[man] Yeah!
Starting at the lowest,
we had one dancer who had a sperm count of zero.
So by our theory, he should have rated as the worst dancer.
translation.ko: 저희 이론이 맞다면 가장 점수가 낮은 댄서겠죠

translation.en: So was he?
-[all] Oh! -[Sammy] Yes!
Yes, he was! It was dancer B!
The lowest dance score and lowest reproductive potency.
translation.ko: 춤 실력도 생식 능력도 가장 낮은 순위네요

translation.en: -[man] Wow. -So, if our theory does hold true,
then the best dancer has the highest sperm count.
translation.ko: 가장 점수가 높은 댄서가 정자 수도 제일 많겠죠

translation.en: So that means dancer I should have a packed house.
translation.ko: 그러니까 댄서 I가 가장 꽉 차 있어야 해요

translation.en: So, does he?
[all] Oh!
[Zainab] The dancer with the highest sperm count was actually dancer F
translation.ko: 정자가 가장 많은 댄서는 사실 댄서 F였습니다

translation.en: with 202 million swimmers.
He's the second best dancer, not the best.
translation.ko: 춤은 첫 번째가 아니라 두 번째로 점수가 높아요

translation.en: [Zainab] So dancer I, the best dancer,
does not have the highest sperm count.
What is dancer I's sperm count?
[all] Whoa!
[Sammy] Eight million.
That's actually pretty low.
Now, if you look at the rest of the scores,
there's no correlation between the dance scores and the sperm count.
translation.ko: 춤 점수랑 정자 수에 연관성이 전혀 없습니다

translation.en: So we clearly see that high sperm count does not make you a sexier dancer.
translation.ko: 그러니까 정자가 많다고 춤을 더 섹시하게 추진 않네요

translation.en: [Sammy] Sounds like junk science to me.
If you are looking for a mate,
don't go to a dance club, go to a sperm lab.
Good night, everyone. Get some rest.
I think ten of you definitely need it.
